timeline.bodyText: @mimosa2 I don't think we need this committed to the code base. I believe you used this for testing?
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: Agree with @arcturus2, this can probably be omitted
replies.author: antares1470

timeline.bodyText: There are lots of these bits of code commented. Is there any reason for this or should they be uncommented?
timeline.author: arcturus2

timeline.bodyText: Can this commented code simply be removed instead?
timeline.author: arcturus2

timeline.bodyText:
Firstly what is the reason when the size is greater than 1 you have to use index 1?
Anyway an optimisation could be as follows though it may be difficult to read:
parameter.setStringValue(booleanInputRecentValues.get(booleanInputRecentValues.size() > 1? 1 : 0));

Other *InputPane classes have the same pattern going on so perhaps they could all be changed or perhaps a new utility class could be used to hold this logic?
timeline.author: arcturus2

timeline.bodyText: @mimosa2 so these set*Value calls was in the original plugin which I think you commented for testing and they are now removed. Are you able to restore the set value calls?
timeline.author: arcturus2

timeline.bodyText:
This if-else can be converted to a tertiary statement:
RecentParameterValues.storeRecentValue(id, !typeValue.contains("LocalDateParameterType") ? value : obj.toString())
